poem:
Title: Seeds Once Sown

The maples yawn,
In the old country - sanctions bloom,
Pale, like the dawn.
Four settlers, now in invisible chains,
Bear the scars of a contested claim.
Land, thirsty from blood and strife,
Rich, yet mired in human life.
Bitter oranges grow,
where olive trees once stood..
A sorrow, hewn in distant crow,
calls for roots watered by justice, not by blood.
